title: EastEnders star Danny-Boy Hatchard offers to drive to meet nine-year-old fan battling cancer
text:
(Picture: BBC) EastEnders star Danny-Boy Hatchard has warmed the hearts of those on social media by offering to drive and visit a nine-year-old cancer patient after discovering that it is her dream to meet the cast of her favourite soap. 
A campaign on Twitter has tagged EastEnders and some of their cast members to ask about arranging a meet up and, after becoming aware of the campaign, Danny-Boy, who played Lee Carter through an emotional depression storyline, got in touch to arrange a visit.
The star now plans to drive and meet young Chloe at the end of this week after making contact with one of the social media users behind the campaign.
@MrDDyer @ShonaBM little 9 year old cancer patients dream is to meet u guys please help Eltham area !! :( pic.twitter.com/VcJjuEhbYv 
— SalPsychic to Celebs (@sallycudmore) March 21, 2017 
@sallycudmore I'm driving south tomorrow and Friday. Happy to pop by and say hello? X
— Danny-Boy Hatchard (@danboy) March 21, 2017 

Other users were deeply moved by Danny-Boy’s gesture and tweeted to share their respect for him contributing to making Chloe’s dreams come true.
What you both done for that beautiful little girl is truly amazing x @danboy @sallycudmore 
— rebecca rees (@rebeccarees82) March 22, 2017 
@danboy @sallycudmore Danny Boy Your One Decent Man Respect & You can come join me for a beer AnyTime 
— Benji nowland (@Nowland_Ben) March 22, 2017 

Meanwhile, it seems like other members of the cast are going to delight Chloe too as Aaron Sidwell, who plays Steven Beale in the soap, confirmed that he and his colleagues were aware of Chloe’s story and confirmed that they are ‘already on it.’
Don't worry. We're already on it! https://t.co/qAeIZTn6dh 
— Aaron Sidwell (@aaronsidwell) March 21, 2017 

This is where the faith in social media and humankind is restored – while social media has some harmful aspects, this is proof that it can be used for good and if it leads to Chloe’s dreams coming true, those behind and contributing to the campaign should be really proud.
